decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly beat down your opponent by playing a lot of cheap, efficient creatures and spells. By using cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Sleight of Hand, you can draw more cards and maintain momentum. Utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Into the Flood Maw helps you refill your hand and keep up the pressure. With a mix of burn spells and creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Slickshot Show-Off, you can control the board while constantly attacking your opponent's life total.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient spells to quickly build a wide board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. By combining creatures with abilities that disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, with cards like Collected Company to quickly flood the board, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter also helps to control the opponent's threats, while still keeping up the pressure.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay using a combination of creatures, removal spells, and disruptive cards. The deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total early on while disrupting their game plan with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. Cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional aggression, while removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat help clear the way for attacks. The deck also has some powerful late-game threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out games if the aggression doesn't finish the opponent off quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a variety of aggressive creatures and burn spells. With a mix of powerful creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, coupled with efficient removal spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to apply pressure early and often. The inclusion of cards like Monstrous Rage and Manifold Mouse provide additional ways to push damage through and close out games swiftly. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and aggression to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on efficiently and quickly assembling the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes various cards for protection and removal to ensure the combo can go off smoothly. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and provide flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up an unstoppable win condition with the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm the opponent. By protecting these key cards with Monument to Endurance and Sheltered by Ghosts, while also maintaining a solid board presence with Seasoned Hallowblade and Guardian of New Benalia, the deck aims to control the battlefield and secure victory. Additionally, the inclusion of removal spells like Fatal Push and disruption cards such as Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and pave the way for a successful combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Lotus Field and Arboreal Grazer, while also utilizing Scapeshift to search for lands. The deck aims to reach a critical mass of lands in play to generate infinite mana, which can then be used to cast powerful spells like Stock Up and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods. The deck also includes cards like Thassa's Oracle as a win condition once the combo is set up. Additionally, Wishclaw Talisman can be used to search for key combo pieces.

The deck focuses on filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing a mix of reanimation spells and creatures with potent effects, the deck aims to set up explosive combos and take control of the game. The key strategy involves carefully managing resources and timing your plays to maximize the effectiveness of your graveyard recursion abilities. By combining strong creatures with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays using cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Mutavault to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Duress to clear the way for your creatures to attack. With removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrade, along with powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to set up their own game plan. The deck's mana base is streamlined for consistency and aggressive plays.

The deck consists of aggressive red cards aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mixture of fast creatures and burn spells. The main strategy is to apply pressure early in the game, utilizing creatures like Robber of the Rich and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Strike and Reckless Rage to clear the way for attacks. Overall, the goal is to maintain a fast pace and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of direct burn spells, efficient creatures, and pump effects. The deck prioritizes fast plays and putting pressure on the opponent early in the game to reduce their life total as quickly as possible. With a low mana curve and a focus on high damage output, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize and mount a defense.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Greasefang Parhelion combo, which involves utilizing Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II in conjunction with other supporting cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade. This combo allows the player to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelming advantage, ultimately leading to victory. The deck also includes various utility cards such as Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect the combo pieces. Overall, this deck aims to efficiently achieve its win condition through strategic card interactions and synergies.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly play aggressive cards and deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck focuses on playing low-cost and efficient creatures like Heartfire Hero, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Emberheart Challenger. It also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to remove threats or deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to control the board early on and pressure the opponent, finishing the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly bring out creatures with strong abilities and deal direct damage to the opponent's life total as fast as possible. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on in the game. The inclusion of Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance and Mutavault provides additional versatility and resilience to the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also having access to card advantage and removal to maintain board control. It also includes the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard to provide additional value and flexibility in deck building. The deck features a mix of counter spells, board wipes, and planeswalkers to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game tempo and out-valuing the opponent through careful resource management and efficient card selection.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's strategies through counterspells, board wipes, and disruptive spells. It aims to slow down the game with cards like Temporary Lockdown and No More Lies while generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional value and consistency through blinking creatures and permanents. The mana base is built to support the control strategy with a mix of color sources and utility lands like Field of Ruin and Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire.
